TF094718-ACCESS TO DRINKING WATER IN
            FRAGILE STATES
theme: City-wide Infrastructure and Service Delivery,State-owned enterprise restructuring and privatization,Infrastructure services for private sector development,Conflict prevention and post-conflict reconstruction

abstracts.cdata!:
Ratings for the Urban Water Sector
            Project for Afghanistan were as follows: outcomes were
            moderately satisfactory, risk to development outcome was
            high, Bank performance was moderately unsatisfactory, and
            Borrower performance was moderately satisfactory. Some
            lessons learned included: the Bank is well placed to support
            a reform agenda if it is willing to sustain support over the
            long term. Implementation though government agencies, even
            if weak, facilitate institutional development by putting
            clients in the driver's seat and promotes learning by
            doing. Fragile and conflict states present a unique context
            that must be well understood and factored into project
            design. Donor financing in the form of co-financing of Bank
            operations, or independent financing of standalone projects
            should take precedence over parallel financing of
            interdependent project components. The objectives of an
            International Development Association (IDA) supported
            project should be achievable independently of donor
            activities, where the government often has little or no
            control on the content, sequencing, or quality of activities.
